Long Covid Patients Report Vibrations, Tremors: ‘My Body Is Moving Inside, It’s Jolting’ Sumathi Reddy3/6/2022

Some Covid-19 patients continue to experience symptoms such as buzzing sensations and shaking months after their initial diagnosis. Their cases are gaining more attention among long Covid advocates and some doctors.

readabilityObject.title: Long Covid Patients Report Vibrations, Tremors: ‘My Body Is Moving Inside, It’s Jolting’
readabilityObject.content:
For Kerri McCrossen Morrison, the sensation feels like an electric toothbrush going off in her chest. The feeling is so intense that it wakes her from a deep sleep at times.

“It feels like someone put something on my bed and it’s vibrating,” she says. “My body is moving inside, it’s jolting, and at night it’s really bad.”
readabilityObject.textContent: A significant number of Covid-19 patients are dealing with symptoms long after the initial infection. The Wall Street Journal asked four patients to share their stories about how lingering effects are affecting their lives. (Video from 11/1/20)For Kerri McCrossen Morrison, the sensation feels like an electric toothbrush going off in her chest. The feeling is so intense that it wakes her from a deep sleep at times.“It feels like someone put something on my bed and it’s vibrating,” she says. “My body is moving inside, it’s jolting, and at night it’s really bad.”
readabilityObject.excerpt: Some Covid-19 patients continue to experience symptoms such as buzzing sensations and shaking months after their initial diagnosis. Their cases are gaining more attention among long Covid advocates and some doctors.
